I think of America as a family—and like any family, we have issues. We have a history of slavery, Jim Crow, and segregation that we need to confront.

And let’s be frank: it’s time for Trump to stop using Twitter to play into our adversaries’ hands. With every deranged tweet, he advances foreign interests by dividing Americans. Social media companies must account for the role they play in amplifying Trump's dangerous rhetoric.

Together with my Republican colleagues, we've now confirmed what I talked about in August 2018: Russians targeted Black voters, and we must act urgently to protect our country’s elections. This is an ongoing threat and we must be prepared.

There’s more: “No single group of Americans was targeted by IRA operatives more than African-Americans.” They posed as Black Americans on social media to explicitly tell Black people “Don’t Vote At All” and “Our Votes Don’t Matter.”

Russians' “overwhelming operational emphasis on race” exploited “hot-button” controversies and used social media to stir up outrage. They used issues like race and immigration to “pit Americans against one another and against their government.”

Russian voter suppression efforts came in three forms. 
1) convincing left-leaning audiences to boycott the election
2) promoting third-party candidates
3) Attacking Hillary among left-leaning audiences

America’s Achilles heel is rooted in racism, and this report confirms that Russia exploited deep racial divisions in a “strategic assault on the United States” to “sow discord” in America in the 2016 presidential election. Here's how they did it:

Thread on our bipartisan Senate Intelligence Committee Russia report👇

Thanks to President @realDonaldTrump, America’s Governors, our amazing health care workers and people of this Great Country, we’re on our way America. We will come back bigger and better than ever before. 🇺🇸

In April, the @WhiteHouse Coronavirus Task Force outlined guidance for Opening Up America Again and thanks to the efforts of millions of Americans we are starting to open up in all 50 states in a safe and responsible way, getting the American people back to work.
Under President @realDonaldTrump’s leadership, we have broken down obstacles to deliver therapeutics and vaccines at a faster pace than ever seen before.

Through the CARES Act and Paycheck Protection Program, $188 billion in loans have been approved for small businesses, helping keep Americans on the payroll while businesses put the health of their workers and communities first.
America is leading the world in testing. In the past two months, nearly 12 MILLION Coronavirus tests have been performed for Americans across the Country.
Over 13 BILLION supplies and critical PPE have been delivered across America to Doctors, Nurses, First Responders, Nursing Homes and businesses in need.

The capacity of our health care system and our amazing health care workers met the challenge and no one in America who has needed a ventilator has been denied a ventilator. The United States is producing 100,000 ventilators in 100 days.

On March 15th, the @WhiteHouse Coronavirus Task Force outlined President @realDonaldTrump’s 15 Days to Slow the Spread. Because of the sacrifices made by millions of Americans and American businesses, we’ve saved lives, flattened the curved and slowed the spread.
In February, at President @realDonaldTrump’s direction, we began the screening of certain passengers coming into the United States and restricted travel from South Korea and Europe.
In January, President @realDonaldTrump took unprecedented action and restricted travel from China to the United States and established the @WhiteHouse Coronavirus Task Force.
Since Day One, President @realDonaldTrump has had no higher priority than the health and safety of the American people. https://t.co/Tmua4J31wU
